de.unima.webtuples

Class WebIsADb

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unima.webtuples.WebIsADb

  • public class WebIsADb
extends Object
    This class sets the connection to the mongodb instances. The class follows the singleton pattern. Therefore only one instance of this class can be instantiated. Additionally this class provides methods to query the isa database.
    Author:
    Julian Seitener, Nacho Vidal and Stefano Faralli

    • Method Detail

      • getAllTuples

        public AllTuplesResultIterator getAllTuples()
                                     throws Exception
        This method will return an Iterator, to iterate through all the tuples. For this purpose every single entry of all the instance tables, which start with i, is returned.
        Returns:
        an instance of AllTuplesResultIterator, to iterate through all the tuples
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getMultipleContextsWithProvid

        public MultipleContextsResultIterator getMultipleContextsWithProvid(Set<String> provids,
                                                                    int limit)
                                                             throws Exception
        This method will return an Iterator, to iterate through all the contexts corresponding to the context ids in provids. For this purpose every single entry of all the instance tables, which start with i, is returned.
        Parameters:
        provids - a set of context id
        limit - a parameter to limit the number of results. 0 means no limits.
        Returns:
        an instance of MultipleContextsResultIterator, to iterate through all the requested contexts
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getMultipleSentenceWithProvid

        public MultipleContextsResultIterator getMultipleSentenceWithProvid(Set<String> provids)
                                                             throws Exception
        This method will return an Iterator, to iterate through all the contexts corresponding to the context ids in provids. For this purpose every single entry of all the instance tables, which start with i, is returned.
        Parameters:
        provids - a set of context id
        Returns:
        an instance of MultipleContextsResultIterator, to iterate through all the requested contexts
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getContextWithProvid

        public ContextResultIterator getContextWithProvid(String provid)
                                           throws Exception
        This method will return an Iterator, to iterate through all the contexts corresponding to the context id provid.
        Parameters:
        provid - : Is the id of a context. The context ID is used to keep the relation between a tuple and the context of the extraction.
        Returns:
        a ContextResultIterator instance to iterate through all the contexts corresponding to the context id provid.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getTuplesWhere

        public TupleQueryResultIterator getTuplesWhere(String instanceHead,
                                               String clazzHead,
                                               String iPreModifier,
                                               String iPostModifier,
                                               String cPreModifier,
                                               String cPostModifier,
                                               String[] pids,
                                               String[] plds,
                                               double minFrequency,
                                               double maxFrequency,
                                               int minPidSpread,
                                               int maxPidSpread,
                                               int minPldSpread,
                                               int maxPldSpread,
                                               boolean strict)
                                        throws Exception
        This method return TupleQueryResultIterator, to iterate through all the tuple that match the specified parameters. Additionally parameters are passed, which further limit the result.
        Parameters:
        instanceHead - : Refers to the core noun of the instance of a tuple. It consists of exactly one word. Examples: "apple", "germany"
        clazzHead - : Refers to the core noun of the class of a tuple. It consists of exactly one word. Examples: "fruit", "country"
        iPreModifier - : Refers to the premodifier of the instance, that has to be present for the core noun. If every premodifier should be retrieved use the wildcard "*". Examples: "red", "*", ""
        iPostModifier - : Refers to the postmodifier of the instance, that has to be present for the core noun. If every postmodifier should be retrieved use the wildcard "*". Examples: "from portugal", "*", ""
        cPreModifier - : Refers to the premodifier of the class, that has to be present for the core noun. If every premodifier should be retrieved use the wildcard "*". Examples: "red", "*", ""
        cPostModifier - : Refers to the postmodifier of the class, that has to be present for the core noun. If every postmodifier should be retrieved use the wildcard "*". Examples: "from portugal", "*", ""
        pids - : Refers to list of pattern IDs. Only if one of the pattern IDs is found in an tuple, it can be returned as result. If every pattern ID should be allowed, pass an null value pids. Example: ["p1","p2"], null
        plds - : Refers to list of pay level domains IDs. Only if one of the pay level domains is found in an tuple, it can be returned as result. If every pay level domain should be allowed, pass an null value plds. Example: ["google.com", "example.org"], null
        minFrequency - : This value specifies the minimum allowed frequency of a result entry. If no minimum frequency threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        maxFrequency - : This value specifies the maximum allowed frequency of a result entry. If no maximum frequency threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        minPidSpread - : This value specifies the minimum allowed pattern id spread of a result entry. The pattern id spread describes the amount of distinct patterns, that identified this tuple. If no minimum pattern id spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        maxPidSpread - : This value specifies the maximum allowed pattern id spread of a result entry. The pattern id spread describes the amount of distinct patterns, that identified this tuple. If no maximum pattern id spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        minPldSpread - : This value specifies the minimum allowed pay level domain spread of a result entry. The pay level domain spread describes the amount of distinct pay level domains, that identified this tuple. If no minimum pay level domain spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        maxPldSpread - : This value specifies the maxumum allowed pay level domain spread of a result entry. The pay level domain spread describes the amount of distinct pay level domains, that identified this tuple. If no maximum pay level domain spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        strict - : This parameter is used to process the pids and plds lists. Value true: Each single pid in pids and each single pld in plds has to be present in a Tuple Value false: Only one pid of the pids and only one pld of the plds has to be present in a Tuple
        Returns:
        a TupleQueryResultIterator, to iterate through all the tuple that match the specified parameters
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getTuplesWhereInstanceLemma

        public TupleQueryResultIterator getTuplesWhereInstanceLemma(String instanceHead,
                                                            boolean strict)
                                                     throws Exception
        This method return TupleQueryResultIterator, to iterate through all the tuple's modifications that match the instance string value.
        Parameters:
        instanceHead - : Refers to the core noun of the instance of a tuple. It consists of exactly one word. Examples: "apple", "germany"
        strict -
        Returns:
        TupleQueryResultIterator, to iterate through all the tuple that match the instance string value.
        Throws:
        Exception

      • getCoreTuplesWhere

        public CoreTupleQueryResultIterator getCoreTuplesWhere(String instance,
                                                       String clazz,
                                                       String[] pids,
                                                       String[] plds,
                                                       double minFrequency,
                                                       double maxFrequency,
                                                       int minPidSpread,
                                                       int maxPidSpread,
                                                       int minPldSpread,
                                                       int maxPldSpread,
                                                       boolean strict)
                                                throws Exception
        Similar to getTuplesWhere this method return a CoreTupleQueryResultIterator iterate through result of a query on the "core" index of the tuples. the core index is meant a groped collection of tuples which share the same instance value and class value.
        Parameters:
        instance - : Refers to the core noun of the instance of a tuple. It consists of exactly one word. Examples: "apple", "germany"
        clazz - : Refers to the core noun of the class of a tuple. It consists of exactly one word. Examples: "fruit", "country"
        pids - : Refers to list of pattern IDs. Only if one of the pattern IDs is found in an tuple, it can be returned as result. If every pattern ID should be allowed, pass an null value pids. Example: ["p1","p2"], null
        plds - : Refers to list of pay level domains IDs. Only if one of the pay level domains is found in an tuple, it can be returned as result. If every pay level domain should be allowed, pass an null value plds. Example: ["google.com", "example.org"], null
        minFrequency - : This value specifies the minimum allowed frequency of a result entry. If no minimum frequency threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        maxFrequency - : This value specifies the maximum allowed frequency of a result entry. If no maximum frequency threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        minPidSpread - : This value specifies the minimum allowed pattern id spread of a result entry. The pattern id spread describes the amount of distinct patterns, that identified this tuple. If no minimum pattern id spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        maxPidSpread - : This value specifies the maximum allowed pattern id spread of a result entry. The pattern id spread describes the amount of distinct patterns, that identified this tuple. If no maximum pattern id spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        minPldSpread - : This value specifies the minimum allowed pay level domain spread of a result entry. The pay level domain spread describes the amount of distinct pay level domains, that identified this tuple. If no minimum pay level domain spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        maxPldSpread - : This value specifies the maximum allowed pay level domain spread of a result entry. The pay level domain spread describes the amount of distinct pay level domains, that identified this tuple. If no maximum pay level domain spread threshold is needed, pass the value 0; Examples: "5", "0"
        strict - : This parameter is used to process the pids and plds lists. Value true: Each single pid in pids and each single pld in plds has to be present in a Tuple Value false: Only one pid of the pids and only one pld of the plds has to be present in a Tuple
        Returns:
        a Tuple Iterator, which contains tuples, that match the specified parameters
        Throws:
        Exception
